intro: Hieracium champaquiense, commonly known as the Champaquí Hieracium, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Uruguay. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium champaquiense is often used in local horticulture and has ecological importance as a food source for pollinators.
